txt.en: 'I bristle at these accusations, and refute them! My Zhélruka have fought and died as bravely as any two Longbeards, and if Durin calls me coward he will answer to my axe! He seeks proof that my Zhélruka have paid the price? Look then upon the corpses of my slain, and gather their fallen weapons! Then you will see that my own folk have done their share... nay, more than their share!\n\n'The Zhélruka release their weapons only when slain! Collect the weapons by their corpses and store them in a barrel at the trench to the north-west so they can be wielded by Longbeards who cast aside their own weapons when the fighting turned fierce! Durin speaks to me of cowardice? He, and you, should look to your own!'
TBD

'The Zhélruka release their weapons only when slain! Collect the weapons by their corpses and store them in a barrel at the trench to the north-west so they can be wielded by Longbeards who cast aside their own weapons when the fighting turned fierce!'
Chapter 4.5: Hammer, Axe, and Sword
You found Trausti in a trench not far from the lakeside while the fighting rages all about him and the War of Three Peaks continues.

'The Zhélruka release their weapons only when slain! Collect the weapons by their corpses and store them in a barrel at the trench to the north-west so they can be wielded by Longbeards who cast aside their own weapons when the fighting turned fierce!'
Defeat enemy forces during the War of Three Peaks ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Find the retreating dwarves Bósi saw near the trench to the north
'I have not been able to get north-west of this trench. Perhaps my father or cousin were pushed that way during the fighting!'

'I bristle at these accusations, and refute them! My Zhélruka have fought and died as bravely as any two Longbeards, and if Durin calls me coward he will answer to my axe! He seeks proof that my Zhélruka have paid the price? Look then upon the corpses of my slain, and gather their fallen weapons! Then you will see that my own folk have done their share... nay, more than their share!\n\n'The Zhélruka release their weapons only when slain! Collect the weapons by their corpses and store them in a barrel at the trench to the north-west so they can be wielded by Longbeards who cast aside their own weapons when the fighting turned fierce! Durin speaks to me of cowardice? He should look to his own!'
Talk to Trausti in the trench not far from the lakeside during the War of Three Peaks
'DNT - Blah!'
Talk to Bori in the trench north-west of Zarkul-sulûn during the War of Three Peaks
Find Bróin or Bósi north-west of Bori's trench
'DNT - Blah!'

'[placeholder], have you seen my father or cousin? I lost track of them after the first assault, and I have not been able to find them amid the chaos. Can you look for them? I want to make sure they are still all right.\n\n'I have not been able to search beyond this trench to the north-west. Perhaps they were pushed that way during the fighting!'
'Ready yourself, [placeholder]! They prepare for another assault!'
'DNT - Blah!'
'There was a great sound of shouting to the north-west! Perhaps my cousin is there?'
Ingór is furious at Durin's suggestion that the Zhélruka prince kept his forces in reserve during the initial assault of the War of Three Peaks.
Bring the Zhélruka weapons to the weapon crate in the trench to the north-west
'I thought Gundabad had unleashed all of its defenders upon us, but it was not so! Another wave of enemies emerged from the mountain, forcing us to give ground!'
DNT - Blah!
Bósi told you he saw dwarves retreating from thick fighting to the north. You should search there for Bróin.
'DNT - Blah!'
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
Bori is in the trench north-west of Zarkul-sulûn during the War of Three Peaks.
Bori wanted you to look for his cousin Bróin or his father Bósi north-west of his trench. He has not seen them since the fighting began, and he is worried for their safety.

Prince Ingór wants you to pick up weapons dropped by his slain warriors as proof that the Zhélruka are shouldering their own share of the war's burden. You should also slay any enemies that break through the line.
Trausti calls to you as you approach
'There was a great sound of shouting from the north-west! Perhaps my cousin is there?'
Collect fallen Zhélruka weapons ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Bori, standing nearby, calls your name
You hear the sound of many dwarves shouting to the north
Defeat!
A crate for storing spare weapons can be found in a trench north-west of Prince Ingór's defensive position during the War of Three Peaks.
Collected Zhélruka weapons ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Defeated enemy forces ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Fight alongside Bósi during the War of Three Peaks
'Here they come!'
'I saw dwarves retreating to a trench to the north! Go help them!'
